Topics: A statement that the study involves research
Questions:
Which of the following statements best describes the nature of the activity described in the consent form?
A) A routine medical treatment with no data collection
B) A personal fitness and nutrition program not related to a study
C) A research study evaluating the effect of triple pre-rehabilitation on radiotherapy for head and neck cancer patients
D) A general health survey conducted by Peking University with no specific patient interventions

Correct answer: C) A research study evaluating the effect of triple pre-rehabilitation on radiotherapy for head and neck cancer patients

Topics: An explanation of the purposes of the research
The expected duration of the subject's participation
Questions:
How long is the duration of the intervention for patients in the pre-rehabilitation group from the time of enrollment?
A) From enrollment until the start of radiotherapy
B) From enrollment until the end of radiotherapy
C) From the start of radiotherapy until the end of radiotherapy
D) From enrollment until 6 weeks after radiotherapy

Correct answer: B) From enrollment until the end of radiotherapy

Topics: Any additional costs to the subject that may result from participation in the research
Questions:
What will be the financial responsibility of the participants in terms of the costs associated with the study?
A) Participants will have to pay for the intervention program.
B) Participants will be charged for the medical measures in case of accidental injury.
C) Participants will not incur any costs for participating in the study.
D) Participants will be responsible for transportation costs to and from the study site.

Correct answer: C) Participants will not incur any costs for participating in the study.

Topics: A description of the procedures to be followed
Questions:
Which of the following statements accurately describes the follow-up procedures for participants in the study?

A) Participants will be followed up only at the beginning and at the end of radiotherapy.
B) Participants will be followed up at four different times: at enrollment, before radiotherapy, in the middle of radiotherapy, and at the end of radiotherapy.
C) Participants will be followed up weekly via phone calls throughout the duration of the study.
D) Participants will be followed up daily through in-person visits during the study.

Correct answer: B) Participants will be followed up at four different times: at enrollment, before radiotherapy, in the middle of radiotherapy, and at the end of radiotherapy.

Topics: The consequences of a subject's decision to withdraw from the research and procedures for orderly termination of participation by the subject
Identification of any procedures which are experimental
The approximate number of subjects involved in the study
Questions:
How many patients are expected to be enrolled in the randomized controlled trial for the Effect of Triple Pre-rehabilitation on Radiotherapy for Head and Neck Cancer Patients?
A) 20 patients in each group; B) 40 patients in each group; C) 60 patients in each group; D) 80 patients in total

Correct answer: B) 40 patients in each group

Topics: A description of any reasonably foreseeable risks or discomforts to the subject
Questions:
What are some of the potential risks or discomforts that participants might experience during the "Effect of triple pre-rehabilitation on radiotherapy for head and neck cancer patients" study?
A) Muscle strain and hypoglycemia due to the intervention program; B) Increased risk of cancer due to participation; C) Immediate disqualification from health insurance coverage; D) Mandatory long-term hospitalization as part of the study protocol

Correct answer: A

Topics: A description of any benefits to the subject or to others which may reasonably be expected from the research
Questions:
Which of the following is a potential benefit to subjects participating in the "Effect of triple pre-rehabilitation on radiotherapy for head and neck cancer patients" study?

A) Guaranteed improvement in health and complete remission of cancer
B) Optimization of mental and physical health and potential reduction of adverse reactions during radiotherapy
C) Financial compensation for time and travel to the study site
D) Immediate access to new cancer treatments not yet available to the public

Correct answer: B

Topics: A disclosure of appropriate alternative procedures or courses of treatment, if any, that might be advantageous to the subject
A statement describing the extent, if any, to which confidentiality of records identifying the subject will be maintained
Questions:
How will your personal information be handled in the study regarding the confidentiality of records?

A) Personal information will be shared publicly to promote the study.
B) Personal information will be replaced with code names or numbers and kept strictly confidential.
C) Personal information will be disclosed to all hospital staff regardless of their involvement in the study.
D) Personal information will be used for marketing purposes by the hospital.

Correct answer: B) Personal information will be replaced with code names or numbers and kept strictly confidential.

Topics: For research involving more than minimal risk, an explanation as to whether any compensation, and an explanation as to whether any medical treatments are available, if injury occurs and, if so, what they consist of, or where further information may be obtained
Questions:
What will happen if a participant suffers an injury as a result of the research procedures in this study?
A) The participant will receive free medical treatment and financial compensation in accordance with the country's relevant laws and regulations.
B) The participant will be responsible for all medical expenses related to the injury.
C) The participant will receive an apology from the research team but no financial compensation or medical treatment.
D) The participant will be provided with health insurance to cover any injury-related costs.

Correct answer: A) The participant will receive free medical treatment and financial compensation in accordance with the country's relevant laws and regulations.

Topics: Research, Rights or Injury: An explanation of whom to contact for answers to pertinent questions about the research and research subjects' rights, and whom to contact in the event of a research-related injury to the subject

A statement that participation is voluntary, refusal to participate will involve no penalty or loss of benefits to which the subject is otherwise entitled, and the subject may discontinue participation at any time without penalty or loss of benefits, to which the subject is otherwise entitled
Questions:
What does the consent form say about your right to withdraw from the study?
A) You may withdraw at any time, but it may affect your current medical treatment.
B) You may withdraw at any time, and it will not affect your current or future medical treatment.
C) Withdrawal from the study is only permitted during the initial stages.
D) If you withdraw, you may face certain penalties or lose benefits you are entitled to.

Correct answer: B) You may withdraw at any time, and it will not affect your current or future medical treatment.
